article:
The '1986â87 Football League Cup', known as the Littlewoods Cup for sponsorship
reasons, was the 27th season of the Football League Cup, a knockout competition
for England's top 92 football clubs.

The competition began on 25 August 1986, and ended with the final on 5 April
1987 at the Wembley Stadium. The final was played between Arsenal and Liverpool.
The match, played in front of 96,000 spectators at Wembley Stadium, was won by
Arsenal 2â1.

Luton Town was thrown out of the competition when they refused to allow Cardiff
City fans to attend the match at Kenilworth Road. This was at the moment when
club's then chairman, Conservative MP David Evans, to introduce a scheme
effective from the start of 1986â87 banning all visiting supporters from the
ground, and requiring home fans to carry identity cards when attending matches.
